intro: Stenostephanus atropurpureus, commonly known as the purple-leafed stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking purple foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers are clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
